result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher G Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation in Rice Lake, Wisconsin within 48 hours. May serve probation in Minnesota if allowed.

miscConds.notes: Must pay monthly child support payments in full and on time. Must seek work at 5 places per week and submit a list to the Child Support Agency if unemployed or under-employed. Must notify the Child Support Agency within 48 hours of any change of address or employment. Must provide the Child Support Agency with his new address today, June 27, 2017.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday, June27, 2017, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 9 days credit if revoked.

  Defendant relates

Pay monthly child support payments in full and on time.
Seek work at 5 places per week and submit list to CSA if unemployed or under-employed.
Notify the CSA of a change of address or employment within 48 hours  
9 days jail credit if revoked

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2017 at 11:00 am.
